comment: If you want an instructor that will help you step by step, do not consider taking his class. Basically in lab we you're ony our own. He's a harsh grader but its just to help you not make simple mistakes in your future labs.  It was hard to understand him sometimes but lab is easy so you could take any teacher & pass

If you want an instructor that will help you step by step, do not consider taking his class. He will help you if you need it but basically in lab we were on our own. He's a harsh grader but its just to help you not make simple mistakes in your future labs.  It was hard to understand him sometimes but lab is easy so you could take any teacher & pass

If you havent ran track prior to this class, you'll have a good grasp of how its done after taking this class. Unclear, Unhelpful, Unapproachable, and the antithesis of everything a quality teacher should provide to its students. Its one thing to receive a poor grade on an assignment, it happens, but when he cant explain why, its a problem. avoid..

Labs were EASY as long as you watched your sig figs and had a good grasp of what was happening in the CHEM 1151 lecture class. He was hard to understand during lab at times and was hard to approach at times if there was a question about the lab. He does take his sweet time grading and posting labs and D2L assignments.
DO NOT TAKE HIM. He is an terrible teacher, can't understate what he is saying. VERY RUDE. grades your lab reports very hard. it was a BIG Mistake taking him.
he's super easy as long as you do your work like the syllabus says. come to class. WATCH YOUR SIG FIGS.rely on the  TA because you can't understand what he says at all!!!

He is not approachable. Thankfully there is a TA and you will find out why if you take this class. Jackson talks like Porky Pig/an auctioneer, a mile a minute. He cannot be understood whatsoever. Someone in my class said, "all I heard was meniscus." So true! Not an impossible class though. The TA is very helpful. His grading is not consistent!

Run for the hills. Avoid at all cost & there should be a quarantine sign at his door. You can't understand what he says. Counts off for opinions and if your answer isn't what's in his answer lab manual, it's wrong. Makes things harder than they have to be. He shouldn't be a professor because no one will learn in his class. He unmotivates you.

He is NOT a good teacher, his grading is terrible! He is so picky on everything that it gets very annoying I don't believe anyone is my class got a 100 on any of their labs. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! The only thing that got me through was the TA

Completely horrible. Do not take the chance on him. You'll survive the class but it won't be easy because he doesn't speak clearly. He grades inconsistently. Please avoid him if you can. He tries you can tell and I can say is understanding when something comes up. But as far as the understanding. There is a lack of that so you have to read before.

His speech highly resembles Mr. Mackey from South Park. He requires a microphone to talk to a class of 20, and if it's broken, he can't be understood at all. If you ask him a question, 4/5 times he will yell at you and belittle you. As for labs, I've never gotten anything higher than an 85. He grades hard, and mercilessly. Avoid. At. All. Costs.
VERY hard to understand (speech pattern is very unclear).  If you struggle in chemistry probably not the right instructor for you.

VERY difficult to understand. Willing to explain things multiple times but not very good at answering questions in multiple ways. Nice guy but that just does not cut it for chemistry lab. If it is at all possible, transfer. His class is easy if you know your stuff. But if you are struggling you are out of luck because of his poor explanation skill.

pretty horrible lab professor.  Just gets frustrated when you ask questions or do something wrong.  Not helpful at all and his grading is ridiculous - he will count off on something when it was clearly asking "in your opinion, what would happen..." and i dont understand how you get something opinionated wrong?  avoid this teacher at all costs

This professor is just plain awful. First off you can't understand him, and he will count one person off for something on a lab and not another person for the same thing. He is rude when you ask questions and is no help whatsoever. Seriously avoid at all costs.

The professor wasn't very clear meaning most of the students did not get what he said. I didnt like his class at all. Didnt understand what he tried to explain. Explained in class using wikipedia, which is not a reliable source (anyone can edit) that itself shows how the class went. HE CANT SPEAK PROPERLY! I dont really know who gave him the job!

He tries to be nice, he really does...but he is a kind of hard to understand :( the way he speaks, makes me not understand what he just said, because he seems to stutter alot :(.He seems to get frustrated if you ask him a question, and makes you feel stupid. You better not make a mistake or blow something up because he WILL yell at you..he tries :/

Where did they find this guy? Seriously. This dude is out there! All I can say is don't expect any sort of help or clarification on anything. You're on your own. Stay ahead of the game or you'll be lost. Better yet, skip this clown and choose another lab instructor.

Avoid.  I don't think I've ever had a teacher this poor in my life.  He is literally incomprehensible.  He mumbles and uses incomplete sentences.  Whenever he is asked a question he becomes visibly frustrated and makes the asker feel stupid. His reaction is so inexplicable it's almost funny.  He appears to hate his job.  I got an A, but ugh.

He is hard to understand. If you ask to stupid question he let's you know. just make sure you read the lab manual befoer class. He is the man, I personally loved this class. Take him, as long as you are not an idiot in chem you will rock this class.
He doesn't seem human.  It's like he's not there unless he's watching something react in lab.  Lame.

Possibly the worst teacher ive had since pre school. Not helpful at all, gets frustrated when you dont understand, can barely understand his speech. If you know chemistry real well you will be fine (I managed to get an A), but you will struggle if it is hard for you (full class when semester started and dropped to less than 10 students).

He is horrible! Do NOT take this class. Yelled at me for asking a question. Not understandable. Doesn't explain anything well and can't explain it in a different way so you understand. Complains about being there. There are much better lab teachers!

He's really nice and he tries to be helpful but he is just so hard to understand. I think his brain works faster than his mouth. If Chem doesn't come easily to you, you need to find another Professor. If the Labs followed what you're doing in class that would be ok, but often the lab is 2 weeks ahead of class so you're not familiar w/the material.

He's hard to understand because he slurs his words, but read the manual and you'll be ok with the experiments. Very good-natured, not very strict and scores lab reports fairly and generously (only takes out 0.5 pts or 1 pt. for sig fig mistakes, etc.). Very approachable and compared to the other lab teachers in Chemistry, he makes Chem easy.
